decks.notes: This deck focuses on using Arclight Phoenix and Ledger Shredder to quickly put pressure on the opponent and deal damage efficiently. With a mix of cheap spells and card draw, it aims to consistently bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thing in the Ice and Spell Pierce to control the board and protect its key threats. Hall of Storm Giants and Otawara, Soaring City provide additional resources and mana fixings to ensure the deck runs smoothly.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures with low casting costs to quickly overwhelm opponents and deal damage. The deck also includes spells that can buff creatures and provide additional advantages in combat. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility in deck building. The mana base is built to support the aggressive playstyle of the deck, while also incorporating a splash of black for extra versatility. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace of aggression and pressure the opponent into making mistakes or being overrun.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using green creatures and mana acceleration. By using cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to ramp up mana quickly, you can play powerful cards like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll early on. Cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Invasion of Ixalan help to boost your devotion to green, making your creatures even stronger. Additionally, Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner provides card draw and mana ramp, while Storm the Festival can help you find key creatures quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with green devotion creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, using Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to generate huge amounts of mana. The deck aims to play big threats like Cavalier of Thorns and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger early on, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. Cards like Storm the Festival and Finale of Devastation help find key creatures, while Leyline of the Guildpact protects them. Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger provide card advantage and utility, helping to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo between Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards like Raffine's Informant and Grisly Salvage to help find key pieces of the combo, while Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes removal spells like Bitter Triumph and Witherbloom Command to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting the key cards of the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, discard effects, and powerful creatures. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, the deck aims to gain an advantage and win through a mix of attrition and powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also includes utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin to further control the battlefield and ensure victory.

The main concept of this Rakdos aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively build board presence and pressure the opponent with a combination of fast creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Voldaren Thrillseeker, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize. High-value cards like Tree of Perdition and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provide additional threats to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes mana fixing lands like Sulfurous Springs and Blackcleave Cliffs to ensure consistent mana supply to play your threats on curve. Overall, the strategy focuses on fast, aggressive plays to quickly close out the game.
